page.title: 13WELL KNOWN IN AMPNEY CRUCIS
page.content: {Willie Carson,}professional flat race jockey, known as the Royal jockey because he rides for the Queen, bought Minster (formerly Ampney) Stud in 1980. He likes to race at York best. His favourite horse is called "Troy". He learnt to ride at nine years old and has won over 2,500 races since he was 19. Cirencester born and educated{Sir {Colin Goad}KCMG was Secretary General of{U.N.M.O.}where he was responsible for a law forbidding the discharge of oil from ships into the sea. He has travelled widely to Russia, China and the USA. He still goes to the USA regularly on Concorde. {Mrs Blannin,}aged 93, is the oldest person in the village.
